version_description:
We update the app regularly to ensure the best experience for you. In this version we include serveral bug fixes and performance improvements.

Let us know what you think of this update at ios@ecobee.com.
- iPhoneX UI improvements

We’ve done a little spring-cleaning for the ecobee app! More closet space means new digs. Maybe you’ve noticed this little product named the ecobee Switch+.

This update accommodates the Switch+, in addition to some major visual updates.

- Illustrations! Our app wears a lot of black, so here’s some colour.
- A new device overview screen that makes room for accessories (you know, Room Sensors). It now shows temperatures around the home, and sensor status.
- A new way to schedule that includes custom comfort settings. Spring’s a tricky season. We hope this fix keeps you comfy.

Make it a habit to stay tuned, as there will be more updates rolling out as the temperatures rise — including a brand new Apple Watch app.

We’ve done a little spring-cleaning for the ecobee app! More closet space means new digs. Maybe you’ve noticed this little product named the ecobee Switch+.

This update accommodates the Switch+, in addition to some major visual updates.

- Illustrations! Our app wears a lot of black, so here’s some colour.
- A new device overview screen that makes room for accessories (you know, Room Sensors). It now shows temperatures around the home, and sensor status.
- A new way to schedule that includes custom comfort settings. Spring’s a tricky season. We hope this fix keeps you comfy.

Make it a habit to stay tuned, as there will be more updates rolling out as the temperatures rise — including a brand new Apple Watch app soon(previous watch app has been removed)

Hi, hello. We heard what you had to say about version 6.0.1. Maybe we went a little overboard with the decluttering.

We've brought back HomeIQ for our iPad users, along with some bug fixes to retain the responsiveness from the last update.

We are still overhauling the app for the better, but ultimately we're building this for you. We are listening, so keep your feedback coming!

Hi, hello. We heard what you had to say about version 6.0.1. Maybe we went a little overboard with the decluttering.

We've brought back HomeIQ for our iPad users, along with some bug fixes to retain the responsiveness from the last update.

We are still overhauling the app for the better, but ultimately we're building this for you. We are listening, so keep your feedback coming!

Behold! With 6.2 comes a whole host of fixes. Most importantly, the reduction of the Smart Off timeout to 1 minute. Others include:

+ Seeing what comfort setting is running on your ecobee
+ Seeing which sensors are participating in that comfort setting (if they're filled, they're participating)
+ General bug fixes and improvements

We've also added a password reset in case you've forgotten. As always, keep the feedback coming.

Behold! With 6.2 comes a whole host of fixes. Most importantly, the reduction of the Smart Off timeout to 1 minute. Others include:

+ Seeing what comfort setting is running on your ecobee
+ Seeing which sensors are participating in that comfort setting (if they're filled, they're participating)
+ General bug fixes and improvements

We've also added a password reset in case you've forgotten. As always, keep the feedback coming.

Come and see—it's 6.3! This release includes an ecobee first: You can now create custom comfort settings on mobile in addition to Home, Away, and Sleep. Create one for when you want to stay warm while working in the basement, or cool during a crowded get-together.

Oh, and bug fixes and improvements. Keep that feedback coming!

With 6.4, we're delivering more. More bug fixes and improvements, that is.

Let us know how your system's transition to summer is going. We're listening!

Hello, Switch+ users! 6.5 comes bearing a brand new feature: Do Not Disturb. Activating it gives Smart On a break. Perfect for when you (or a loved one) is sleeping.

And as always, bug fixes and improvements to keep things running smoothly.

6.6 brings big news: the ecobee iPad dashboard is back. This is the first phase of its return, but we'd love your feedback nonetheless.

In other platform news, we've also made some improvements on the iPhone widget.

6.6 brings big news: the ecobee iPad dashboard is back. This is the first phase of its return, but we'd love your feedback nonetheless.

In other platform news, we've also made some improvements on the iPhone widget.

6.7 brings yet another frequent request to life: iPad now supports both landscape and portrait orientations.

And as always, bug fixes and improvements.

6.7 brings yet another frequent request to life: iPad now supports both landscape and portrait orientations.

And as always, bug fixes and improvements, specifically the previous blank screen issue has been resolved.
6.9 comes with bug fixes and improvements to keep the app running smoothly. Stay tuned for more in the next release!
6.10 comes with bug fixes and improvements to keep the app running smoothly. Stay tuned for more in the next release!
6.11 comes with bug fixes and improvements to keep the app running smoothly.
Version 6.12 brings you bug fixes and improvements.

6.13 brings yet another frequent request to life: iPad now supports the Switch+.

And as always, bug fixes and improvements.

Mobile introduces thermostat preferences that provide more control and customization to your settings (can we get a "woot woot!"?), allowing you to easily update your device name, temperature display, hold action, heating range, and cooling range.
And because we just can't help ourselves, bug fixes and improvements.

Mobile introduces thermostat preferences that provide more control and customization to your settings (can we get a "woot woot!"?), allowing you to easily update your device name, temperature display, hold action, heating range, and cooling range.
And because we just can't help ourselves, bug fixes and improvements.
Version 6.15 brings you bug fixes and improvements.
Version 6.16 brings you bug fixes and improvements.
Version 6.17 brings you bug fixes and improvements.
Version 6.18 brings you bug fixes and improvements.
Version 6.19 brings you bug fixes and improvements.

We're moving to the lucky number of updates—7.0.

You can now control the app from your Apple Watch (complications to follow soon), and new designations will begin to be added to your Home's profile, where you can name your Home and assign devices to it. All that, and an overall navigation revamp to boot.

Let us know what you think of this update at ios@ecobee.com

We update the app regularly to ensure the best experience for you. This version contains a fix to a problem causing black screens for some users. It also contains fixes to entering text on your iPad, enhancements to the ecobee Apple Watch app, and many other bug fixes and improvements.

We update the app regularly to ensure the best experience for you. This version fixes the app not starting up for some people. It also fixes weather display for some people who had disabled the 24 hour clock, and many other bug fixes and improvements.

This version features Apple Watch app enhancements, including making temperature changes follow your thermostat's Hold Duration; enhanced support for the all-new SmartThermostat with voice control; and also contains many other bug fixes and improvements.

We update the app regularly to ensure the best experience for you. This version features:

- HomeKit support for registering Switch+; and
- a fix to make iPad sensor lists no longer get cut off; and
- enhanced support for the all-new SmartThermostat with voice control; and
- many other bug fixes and improvements.

Let us know what you think of this update at ios@ecobee.com.

We update the app regularly to ensure the best experience for you. This version features a fix to the time zone when you create a vacation (if your iOS device isn't in the same time zone as your ecobee devices), as well as many other bug fixes and improvements.

Let us know what you think of this update at ios@ecobee.com.

We update the app regularly to ensure the best experience for you. New in this version:

- you can now change the temperature on your thermostat when viewing your home, so long as it's the only device in your home; and
- your list of homes is now sorted alphabetically; and
- many other bug fixes and improvements.

Let us know what you think of this update at ios@ecobee.com.

We update the app regularly to ensure the best experience for you. New in this version:

- it's now easier to understand what information you're sharing (and not sharing!) when enrolling in eco+; and
- several fixes to make it easier to install your ecobee devices; and
- improvements to compatibility to iOS 13, with more coming soon; and
- many other bug fixes and improvements.

Let us know what you think of this update at ios@ecobee.com.

We update the app regularly to ensure the best experience for you. In this version, we include more fixes to bugs that would cause the app to be unable to load, fixes to several crashes, as well as many other bug fixes and improvements.

Let us know what you think of this update at ios@ecobee.com.

We update the app regularly to ensure the best experience for you. In this version, we include fixes for:

* a common bug that would cause the app to be unable to load;
* a bug that would cause Fahrenheit degrees to be displayed with a decimal point in some cases; and
* a bug that would make all eco+ features appear disabled if you disabled one eco+ feature.

Let us know what you think of this update at ios@ecobee.com.

We update the app regularly to ensure the best experience for you. In this version, we include fixes for:

* a bug where unassigned devices wouldn't appear after tapping unassigned banner
* disabling an individual eco+ feature made it appear all features were disabled
* a bug we’re the widget/extension wouldn’t update

Let us know what you think of this update at ios@ecobee.com.

We update the app regularly to ensure the best experience for you. In this version, we include:

* a fix to make sure the eco+ info screen doesn't display blank;
* on your iPad, accurately showing whether you've disabled eco+;
* the ability for you to enter your utility information when you enable Time of Use or Community Energy Savings from inside eco+ settings;
* a fix to an occasional crash that happened in the Today widget; and
* a fix to a bug in HomeKit scenes, which could result in devices being removed from a scene, even if you hadn't changed it.

Let us know what you think of this update at ios@ecobee.com.

We update the app regularly to ensure the best experience for you. In this version, we include support for Family Accounts, an easy way for families to join and control their Home's ecobee devices without sharing credentials. Family Members will be able to view Home information, see and control devices in the Home and easily invite new Members to join the Home. Administrative privileges – including account changes, removal or registration of devices, or enrollment in services like eco+ – will be restricted to the Home Owner.

Also in this version:

* Your eco+ enabled setting no longer flickers after you change it;
* Smart Home and Away are now correctly displayed in the eco+ settings if you've enrolled in eco+, and under the sensors settings if you haven't.

Let us know what you think of this update at ios@ecobee.com.

Let us know what you think of this update at ios@ecobee.com.

We update the app regularly to ensure the best experience for you. In this version, we include a new, more secure login method, via ecobee.com.

Also in this version, we fixed bugs so that:
* You can now accept an invitation to an ecobee Home if your phone is running iOS 12; and
* The Apple Watch app now shows thermostats in homes you've joined.

This version also includes many other bug fixes and improvements.

Let us know what you think of this update at ios@ecobee.com.

We update the app regularly to ensure the best experience for you. In this version, we include a new, more secure login method, via ecobee.com.

Also in this version, we fixed bugs so that:
* You can now accept an invitation to an ecobee Home if your phone is running iOS 12; and
* The Apple Watch app now shows thermostats in homes you've joined.

This version also includes many other bug fixes and improvements.

Let us know what you think of this update at ios@ecobee.com.

We update the app regularly to ensure the best experience for you. In this version, we introduce support for two-factor authentication, an easy way to secure your account and ensure your devices are more protected than ever.

Also in this version, we fixed bugs so that:
* You can once again use passwords with special characters;
* You won't be asked to log in to the app as frequently;
* The Close/"X" button on the Air Filters banner is easier to tap; and
* Adding sensors to your ecobee Home is easier and more reliable.

This version also includes many other bug fixes and improvements.

Let us know what you think of this update at ios@ecobee.com.

We update the app regularly to ensure the best experience for you. This version introduces support for the new SmartCamera with voice control, SmartSensors for doors and windows, and ecobee Haven, the home monitoring subscription that works with all your ecobee devices and your smartphone to give you clarity and peace of mind.

Also in this version, we fixed bugs so that:
* The app crashes much less frequently; and
* The watch app can sign in much more reliably.

This version also includes many other bug fixes and improvements.

Let us know what you think of this update at ios@ecobee.com.

We update the app regularly to ensure the best experience for you. This version introduces support for the new SmartCamera with voice control, SmartSensors for doors and windows, and ecobee Haven, the home monitoring subscription that works with all your ecobee devices and your smartphone to give you clarity and peace of mind.

Also in this version, we fixed bugs so that:
* eco+ does not show in your thermostat menu if you don't have eco+ enabled; and
* The app crashes much less frequently; and
* The watch app can sign in much more reliably.

This version also includes many other bug fixes and improvements.

Let us know what you think of this update at ios@ecobee.com.

We update the app regularly to ensure the best experience for you. This version introduces support for the new SmartCamera with voice control, SmartSensors for doors and windows, and ecobee Haven, the home monitoring subscription that works with all your ecobee devices and your smartphone to give you clarity and peace of mind.

Also in this version, we made changes so that:
* The SmartCamera's Motion Sensitivity and Activity Zone settings now appear in the Detection Settings menu; and
* When setting up your SmartCamera, you're only prompted to set up Autopilot when you're using an iPhone (instead of also prompting on iPad); and
* The light switch menu loads immediately, instead of showing a spinner forever; and
* Certain screens no longer show up blank occasionally.

This version also includes many other bug fixes and improvements.

Let us know what you think of this update at ios@ecobee.com.

* Login and logout is much more reliable;
* Autopilot for SmartCamera works more reliably;
* The SmartCamera's Motion Sensitivity and Activity Zone settings now appear in the Detection Settings menu; and
* When setting up your SmartCamera, you're only prompted to set up Autopilot when you're using an iPhone (instead of also prompting on iPad); and
* The light switch menu loads immediately, instead of showing a spinner forever; and
* Certain screens no longer show up blank occasionally.

This version also includes many other bug fixes and improvements.

Let us know what you think of this update at ios@ecobee.com.

We update the app regularly to ensure the best experience for you. This version introduces support for the new SmartCamera with voice control, SmartSensors for doors and windows, and ecobee Haven, the home monitoring subscription that works with all your ecobee devices and your smartphone to give you clarity and peace of mind.

Also in this version, we made changes so that:
* Login and logout is much more reliable;
* You know at a glance why your SmartCamera has been turned off;
* You can find out how to arm and disarm ecobee Haven with Alexa; and
* eco+ settings are easier to change.

This version also includes many other bug fixes and improvements.

Let us know what you think of this update at ios@ecobee.com.

We update the app regularly to ensure the best experience for you.

Important note: you now need to be running iOS 12 or later to upgrade to the latest version of the app.

In this version, we made changes so that:
* eco+ settings are easier to change; and
* Reminders (such as "service your HVAC equipment" and "change your furnace filter") are now easier to navigate.

This version also includes many other bug fixes and improvements.

Let us know what you think of this update at ios@ecobee.com.

We update the app regularly to ensure the best experience for you.

Important note: you now need to be running iOS 12 or later to upgrade to the latest version of the app.

In this version, we made changes so that:
* You will no longer be asked to log back in as frequently;
* eco+ settings display more reliably; and
* Your SmartCamera no longer shows its green "live view" light for 30 seconds after you've disconnected from it.

This version also includes many other bug fixes and improvements.

Let us know what you think of this update at ios@ecobee.com.

We update the app regularly to ensure the best experience for you. This version adds support for using authenticator apps (like Google Authenticator) when securing your account with two-factor authentication (2FA), as an alternative to using text message/SMS.

Also in this version, we made changes so that:
* You can move your SmartCamera's live view directly, by using swipe and pinch gestures while watching it;
* You can delete multiple recordings at a time from your SmartCamera's history view; and
* You will see "Trouble connecting to your device" much less often.

This version also includes many other bug fixes and improvements.

Let us know what you think of this update at ios@ecobee.com.

We update the app regularly to ensure the best experience for you. This version adds support for using authenticator apps (like Google Authenticator) when securing your account with two-factor authentication (2FA), as an alternative to using text message/SMS.

Also in this version, we made changes so that:
* You can move your SmartCamera's live view directly, by using swipe and pinch gestures while watching it;
* If your thermostat has alerts (like HVAC servicing and filter replacement reminders) that you haven't acknowledged, you'll be able to see them from the home screen; and
* You can now change your SmartCamera's audio settings from a dedicated settings page.

This version also includes many other bug fixes and improvements.

Let us know what you think of this update at ios@ecobee.com.

We update the app regularly to ensure the best experience for you. This version adds support for using authenticator apps (like Google Authenticator) when securing your account with two-factor authentication (2FA), as an alternative to using text message/SMS.

Also in this version, we made changes so that:
* You can move your SmartCamera's live view directly, by using swipe and pinch gestures while watching it; and
* You can learn more about eco+ programs while setting up eco+.

This version also includes many other bug fixes and improvements.

Let us know what you think of this update at ios@ecobee.com.

We update the app regularly to ensure the best experience for you.

Some of the changes we've made to improve your experience include:
* Haven users can turn on notifications indicating when their home monitoring service is set to arm or disarm.
* If your network settings are preventing access to ecobee, a screen will now display this as the issue.
* When disabling the Community Energy Savings component of eco+, you can now find out how to contact your utility to unenrol.
* Camera users can now set the area their camera shows by default, by using the Pan controls when viewing their camera live.

And that's just the beginning. There are many more bug fixes and improvements this update will bring to your ecobee experience.

Questions or comments? Tell us what you think at ios@ecobee.com.

We update the app regularly to ensure the best experience for you.

Some of the changes we've made to improve your experience include:
* eco+ now displays properly in the Apple Watch app.
* Haven users can turn on notifications indicating when their home monitoring service is set to arm or disarm.
* Camera users can now set the area their camera shows by default, by using the Pan controls when viewing their camera live.
* Initial preparation for iOS 14, including making sure the bottom tab names don't get cut off.

And that's just the beginning. There are many more bug fixes and improvements this update will bring to your ecobee experience.

Questions or comments? Tell us what you think at ios@ecobee.com.

Some of the changes we've made to improve your experience include:
* On iOS 12, ecobee launches correctly again.
* eco+ now displays properly in the Apple Watch app.
* Haven users can turn on notifications indicating when their home monitoring service is set to arm or disarm.
* Camera users can now set the area their camera shows by default, by using the Pan controls when viewing their camera live.
* Initial preparation for iOS 14, including making sure the bottom tab names don't get cut off.

And that's just the beginning. There are many more bug fixes and improvements this update will bring to your ecobee experience.

Questions or comments? Tell us what you think at ios@ecobee.com.

We update the app regularly to ensure the best experience for you.

Some of the changes we've made to improve your experience include:
* Fixes for iOS 14:
* Your thermostat's temperature will display correctly if you've set your iOS device to use Fahrenheit.
* You'll be able to see the temperature as you adjust it from the home screen if you're using Celsius.
* You can now set up Spotify on your SmartCamera from the Account tab.

And that's just the beginning. There are many more bug fixes and improvements this update will bring to your ecobee experience.

Questions or comments? Tell us what you think at ios@ecobee.com.

We update the app regularly to ensure the best experience for you.

Some of the changes we've made to improve your experience include:
* You can now complete your Community Energy Savings rebate from within the ecobee app if your utility needs more information before processing it.
* You can learn much more about the eco+ Time of Use feature, what it does, and how it works, while selecting your time-of-use rate.

And that's just the beginning. There are many more bug fixes and improvements this update will bring to your ecobee experience.

Questions or comments? Tell us what you think at ios@ecobee.com.

We update the app regularly to ensure the best experience for you. This version brings many bug fixes and improvements to your ecobee experience.

Questions or comments? Let us know what you think of this update at ios@ecobee.com.

We update the app regularly to ensure the best experience for you.

Some of the changes we've made to improve your experience include:
* The ecobee app now supports receiving push notifications for important alerts from your thermostat. You can manage your push notifications from the Account tab.
* You can now unenrol in the eco+ Community Energy Savings program from the app if you haven't yet received your rebate.
* You can now send an email to your energy provider to unenrol in the eco+ Community Energy Savings program after receiving a rebate.

And that's just the beginning. There are many more bug fixes and improvements this update will bring to your ecobee experience.

Questions or comments? Tell us what you think at ios@ecobee.com.

We update the app regularly to ensure the best experience for you.

We're proud to announce that this release includes two new iOS 14 widgets, one displaying your thermostat's current temperature, and one showing the state of your ecobee Haven home monitoring system.

(The previous widget is still available in the legacy section at the bottom of your widget screen. It might be blank or missing after upgrading to this version because of an iOS 14 issue; to fix that, you might need to restart your phone or remove and re-add the widget.)

Some of the other changes we've made to improve your experience include:
* You can use the ecobee Apple Watch app on Series 3 Apple Watches again!
* Push notifications from your ecobee SmartCamera now show an image of what triggered the push notification.
* Push notifications from ecobee Haven now let you disarm your home monitoring system from the notification itself.
* We've introduced preliminary support for Apple's Shortcuts app, allowing you to set your thermostat's comfort setting and the state of your ecobee Haven home monitoring system using Shortcuts and HomeKit automations.
* You can now control whether your camera's recordings pan and zoom to keep motion and people in view by using the Smart Focus setting.

And that's just the beginning. There are many more bug fixes and improvements this update will bring to your ecobee experience.

Questions or comments? Tell us what you think at ios@ecobee.com.

We update the app regularly to ensure the best experience for you.

We're proud to announce that this release includes two new iOS 14 widgets, one displaying your thermostat's current temperature, and one showing the state of your ecobee Haven home monitoring system.

(The previous widget is still available in the legacy section at the bottom of your widget screen. It might be blank or missing after upgrading to this version because of an iOS 14 issue; to fix that, you might need to restart your phone or remove and re-add the widget.)

Some of the other changes we've made to improve your experience include:
* It's easier to set up Baby Mode for your ecobee SmartCamera.
* Several enhancements to iOS 14 widgets, including showing what HVAC equipment is currently running in the thermostat widget.
* You can use the ecobee Apple Watch app on Series 3 Apple Watches again!
* Push notifications from your ecobee SmartCamera now show an image of what triggered the push notification.
* Push notifications from ecobee Haven now let you disarm your home monitoring system from the notification itself.
* We've introduced preliminary support for Apple's Shortcuts app, allowing you to set your thermostat's comfort setting, the state of your ecobee Haven home monitoring system, and whether your ecobee SmartCamera is turned on using Shortcuts and HomeKit automations.

And that's just the beginning. There are many more bug fixes and improvements this update will bring to your ecobee experience.

Special note: v8.4 of the ecobee app will be the final update for iOS 12.

Questions or comments? Tell us what you think at ios@ecobee.com.

We update the app regularly to ensure the best experience for you.

Note: this will be the final update of the ecobee app for devices running iOS 12. Only devices running iOS 13 and higher will receive future updates.

Some of the other changes we've made to improve your experience include:
* Switching back to a pop-up screen when you change your thermostat's HVAC mode.
* It's easier to set up and use Baby Mode for your ecobee SmartCamera.
* Several enhancements to iOS 14 widgets, including showing what HVAC equipment is currently running in the thermostat widget. (The previous widget is still available, too.)
* You can use the ecobee Apple Watch app on Series 3 Apple Watches again!

And that's just the beginning. There are many more bug fixes and improvements this update will bring to your ecobee experience.

Questions or comments? Tell us what you think at ios@ecobee.com.

Some of the changes we've made to improve your experience include:
* Switching back to a pop-up screen when you change your thermostat's HVAC mode.
* Fixing a bug that made your room sensors show up under the wrong thermostat.
* It's easier to set up and use Baby Mode for your ecobee SmartCamera.
* Several enhancements to iOS 14 widgets, including showing what HVAC equipment is currently running (or not running) in the thermostat widget. (The previous widget is still available, too.)

And that's just the beginning. There are many more bug fixes and improvements this update will bring to your ecobee experience.

Questions or comments? Tell us what you think at ios@ecobee.com.

We update the app regularly to ensure the best experience for you.

Some of the changes we've made to improve your experience include:
* Switching back to a pop-up screen when you change your thermostat's HVAC mode.
* Fixing a bug that made your room sensors show up under the wrong thermostat.
* It's easier to set up and use Baby Mode for your ecobee SmartCamera.
* Showing what HVAC equipment is currently running (or not running) in the iOS 14 thermostat widget. Turn on the "Show Scheduled Temperature" setting on your widget if you don't see it. (The previous widget is still available, too.)

And that's just the beginning. There are many more bug fixes and improvements this update will bring to your ecobee experience.

Questions or comments? Tell us what you think at ios@ecobee.com.

We update the app regularly to ensure the best experience for you.

Some of the changes we've made to improve your experience include:
* Allowing you to choose whether to bypass Do Not Disturb mode for ecobee Haven Activity Alert push notifications (by using iOS Critical Alerts).
* Fixing a bug that made your room sensors show up under the wrong thermostat.
* It's easier to set up and use Baby Mode for your ecobee SmartCamera.
* Showing what HVAC equipment is currently running (or not running) in the iOS 14 thermostat widget. Turn on the "Show Scheduled Temperature" setting on your widget if you don't see it. (The previous widget is still available, too.)

And that's just the beginning. There are many more bug fixes and improvements this update will bring to your ecobee experience.

Questions or comments? Tell us what you think at ios@ecobee.com.

We update the app regularly to ensure the best experience for you.

Some of the changes we've made to improve your experience include:
* Introducing support for complications on the Apple Watch! You can view your current temperature at a glance, and configure which thermostat to display with the "Show on complication" toggle in the Watch app.
* Allowing you to choose whether to bypass Do Not Disturb mode for ecobee Haven push notifications by using iOS Critical Alerts.
* Adding the ability to create a Shortcut to set a fan hold on your thermostat.
* Fixing a bug that made your room sensors show up under the wrong thermostat.
* Showing a loading indicator (instead of the incorrect "offline") when you open the app by tapping on the iOS 14 thermostat widget. (The old widget is still available, too.)

And that's just the beginning. There are many more bug fixes and improvements this update will bring to your ecobee experience.

Questions or comments? Tell us what you think at ios@ecobee.com.

Some of the changes we've made to improve your experience include:
* Introducing support for complications on the Apple Watch! You can view your current temperature at a glance, and configure which thermostat to display with the "Show on complication" toggle in the Watch app.
* Alerts from your thermostat now let you choose "remind me later" instead of only "dismiss".
* Adding the ability to create a Shortcut to set a fan hold on your thermostat.
* Showing a loading indicator (instead of the incorrect "offline") when you open the app by tapping on the iOS 14 thermostat widget. (The old widget is still available, too.)

And that's just the beginning. There are many more bug fixes and improvements this update will bring to your ecobee experience.
